Festival: Riverview Festival / Jersey City Jazz Festival
Lineup: Champian Fulton Trio; the Orrin Evans Trio with Robert Hurst & Mark Whitfield II; Trio HGH with John Hebert, George Garzone, and Billy Hart; David Kikoski Trio featuring Billy Hart and Joe Martin; Riverview Jazz All-Stars featuring Lezlie Harrison; Lance Bryant & Shout!; Paris Monster; Nation Beat; Mambo Legends Orchestra; United Children's Music Project; Rachel Therrien Latin Jazz Project; Winard Harper & Jeli Posse; Tyreek McDole Jam Session; Moses Patrou Organ Trio; Kate Curran & Ron Affif; the Curtis Brothers featuring Craig Handy; George Coleman Organ Quartet with George Coleman (sax), George Coleman Jr. (dr), Brian Charette (org), Peter Bernstein (gtr); the Brianna Thomas Band; Yvonnick Prene Quintet "LISTEN!"; Honk Family Band; Cyro Baptista's Chama; LA EXCELENCIA; NJCU Jazz Combo; Alon Nechushtan Quartet; Juanga Lakunza Quintet with Kazemde George (tenor sax), Oscar Perez (piano), John Benitez (bass), EJ Strickland (drums); Winard Harper & Friends
Info about Festival: The Jersey City Jazz Festival started with a community concert in 2013 at the Riverview Farmers Market in Jersey City Heights. The non-profit organization Riverview Jazz was formed, and in a few short years, the organization was producing up to 100 jazz events a year and all free to the public. In 2019, the yearly Riverview Festival was renamed the Jersey City Jazz Festival and drew a crowd of 30,000 attendees, making it one of the largest jazz festivals in the NYC tri-state area. Thanks to our generous donors and sponsors, we have now secured our current home, the Exchange Place waterfront, and are excited to present the most extensive festival line-up for 2024.

Lineup: The Andy Roberts Quartet; The Corsair Blue Jazz Orchestra; Fred Hughes with Steve Meashey & Dan Monaghan; Temple Avenue Jazz Quartet; Jay Hoerr with Sheldon Markel; Von & Abbey Lewis; Allison & Justin Droegemuller
Info about Festival: A weekly treat of jazz, drinks and small plate fare on the patio. Every Thursday from Memorial Day through Labor Day.

Lineup: Nathan and the Zydeco Cha Chas; Delbert Anderson; 8 Ohms Band; Muneer Nasser Quintet; Josanne Francis; US Air Force Band's Airment of Note; Jake Blount; Brent Birckhead; Pleana Libre; Leigh Pilzer's Seven Pointed Star

The Baltimore Jazz Festival is a multi-day culturally enriched, cross generational musical experience in the greater Baltimore area. The festival showcases jazz legends and up-and-coming jazz artists, as well as "jazz adjacent" genres and their respective artists.
